name: Argument Type Inference - Generalization over Relations
description: Tests the ability to infer relations with types from relations with instances. If X relates to Y and Y is of type T, then X relates to something of type T.

theory.natural_language: Lion hunts Zebra. Zebra is an animal. Animal is a living thing. Shark eats Tuna. Tuna is a fish. Fish is an animal. Cat chases Mouse. Mouse is a rodent. Rodent is a mammal.

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Lion hunts animal because Lion hunts Zebra and Zebra is an animal.
expected_answer.explanation: Lion HUNTS Zebra, Zebra IS_A animal → Lion HUNTS animal (argument type inference)

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Cat chases mammal because Cat chases Mouse, Mouse is a rodent, and rodent is a mammal.
expected_answer.explanation: Cat CHASES Mouse, Mouse IS_A rodent, rodent IS_A mammal → Cat CHASES mammal (transitive argument type inference)

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Shark eats animal because Shark eats Tuna, Tuna is a fish, and fish is an animal.
expected_answer.explanation: Shark EATS Tuna, Tuna IS_A fish, fish IS_A animal → Shark EATS animal
